summary_reasoning: The report covers most expected sections with solid structure: cover and contents, Analyst Note, Business Description, Strategy & Outlook, Bulls/Bears, Moat, Valuation & Profit Drivers, Risks, Capital Allocation, Financials Snapshot, ESG, Appendix, and Sources. Evidence is generally integrated with multiple SEC/Reuters citations, and valuation presents explicit drivers (revenue CAGR, margin trajectory, WACC, terminal multiple) that connect to fair value. However, the Financials Snapshot is generic (revenue, EPS, margins, FCF, ROIC) and omits core sector-specific KPIs for a data/ratings vendor—such as ARR/NRR, organic growth by segment, debt issuance volumes, and index-linked AUM—triggering the hard cap at Fair. Peer benchmarking is largely absent (beyond a brief ESG comparison) and no scenario/sensitivity analysis is provided. A few material claims (e.g., leadership change, recurring share count reduction, OSTTRA JV sale and interest expense guidance) lack citations, and a minor inconsistency exists between the stated P/E “low 30s” and ~36x in the valuation section. Overall, while breadth is good and linkages exist, missing sector KPIs in the financials and limited peer/scenario context constrain comprehensiveness.

contradictions.description: Fair value implies P/E in the "low 30s" (Analyst Note) vs ~36× forward EPS in 2026 (Valuation)

uncited_claims: Reference to OSTTRA JV sale without source in Strategy/Capital Allocation
New leadership team installed in late 2024 (no citation)
Interest expense guidance only ~$10m higher annually (no citation)
